gene.function: FUNCTION: Acetylates soluble but not nucleosomal histone H4 at 'Lys-5' (H4K5ac) and 'Lys-12' (H4K12ac) and, to a lesser extent, acetylates histone H2A at 'Lys-5' (H2AK5ac). Has intrinsic substrate specificity that modifies lysine in recognition sequence GXGKXG. May be involved in nucleosome assembly during DNA replication and repair as part of the histone H3.1 and H3.3 complexes. May play a role in DNA repair in response to free radical damage. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11585814, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20953179, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22615379, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9427644}.
gene.subcellularLocation: SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: [Isoform A]: Nucleus matrix.; SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: [Isoform B]: Cytoplasm. Nucleus. Nucleus matrix. Nucleus, nucleoplasm. Note=Localization is predominantly nuclear in normal cells. Treatment with hydrogen peroxide or ionizing radiation enhances nuclear localization through redistribution of existing protein.
